value.message:
Update Orders database state (SHM and WAL files)

Modified Orders.db-shm and Orders.db-wal, reflecting changes to the database state. These updates are likely due to recent inserts, updates, or deletions in the Orders database.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Consolidate to single API; unify data access & docs

- Removed separate MinApi project; all data now served by WiredBrainCoffee.API
- Refactored Razor Pages to fetch menu data via HttpClient from API (async)
- Updated IMenuService to async; removed hardcoded menu data
- Added shared model/constants references to frontends
- Updated Blazor UI for .NET 9 dynamic component API changes
- Standardized ports and API base URL config across all projects
- Added detailed architecture, quick start, and troubleshooting docs
- Included start-all.ps1 script for easy multi-project startup
- Added Orders.db SQLite files for API data persistence
- Both frontends now demonstrate hybrid architecture using the same API
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message:
Consolidate API, models, and config; remove MinApi project

- Removed WiredBrainCoffee.MinApi project; migrated all order endpoints, models, and services into WiredBrainCoffee.API
- Added WiredBrainCoffee.Shared for centralized constants and configuration keys; referenced by all projects
- Unified MenuItem and Order models in WiredBrainCoffee.Models; introduced OrderDto for API/database transport
- Centralized menu data in API MenuService; refactored MenuController and added endpoints for ID, slug, and category
- Merged all minimal API endpoints (orders, status, health) into API Program.cs; unified SignalR and middleware
- Standardized configuration via appsettings.json in all projects; API URLs and connection strings now config-driven
- Updated project references and solution structure; removed all MinApi references
- Added CONSOLIDATION_SUMMARY.md and MINAPI_REMOVAL_NOTICE.md for documentation
- Cleaned up duplicate/outdated files and standardized logging across the solution

All projects now use a single API, shared models, and configuration, eliminating duplication and improving maintainability.
value.author: Mark Hazleton

value.message: Update README.md to reflect full-stack demo and project details
value.author: Mark Hazleton
